summary: This is an email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO-SDNY) to the Office of the Attorney General and Deputy Attorney General. It outlines plans to indict two correctional officers at the Manhattan Correctional Center (MCC) for making false statements and conspiring to obstruct the MCC's functions related to the night of Jeffrey Epstein's suicide. The indictment and arrests are scheduled for November 19, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document states that the charges against the correctional officers stem from their conduct on the night Epstein committed suicide.

events.title: Planned Indictment and Arrests of MCC Officers
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York plans to seek an indictment and the FBI-NY will conduct arrests of two correctional officers from the Manhattan Correctional Center.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Suicide
events.description: The night Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide at the Manhattan Correctional Center, which is the basis for the investigation into the correctional officers' conduct.

keyFacts: Two correctional officers at the Manhattan Correctional Center (MCC) are to be indicted for making false statements and conspiring to obstruct the MCC's functions.
The charges are directly related to the officers' conduct on the night Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide.
The indictment was originally planned for November 14, 2019, but was rescheduled to November 19, 2019, for operational reasons.
The FBI-NY is scheduled to arrest the officers on the same day the indictment is sought.
The communication is an official update from the USAO-SDNY to senior Department of Justice leadership regarding this planned legal action.
